Adya Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 2594 reviews

The location of the hotel is comfortable to get around. Cenang beach is quite a distance away, Langkawi parade mall behind the hotel is a plus, convenient to buy food, drinks etc.

There were also shop lots opposite the hotel. The views for a superior room from the balcony (eagles square, mountain, lake and sea views) were good. The buffet breakfast had a variety although the variety was about the same every day. Can skip the porridge as it is usually not very warm. The shower was easy to use. Room came with disposable slippers so do not need to bring own to hotel. Hotel staff were helpful with directions / recommendations. Travel counter staff were helpful with tour queries however their pricing for tour packages was much higher. Room noise was audible from next room, and can also be difficult to sleep when the cars drove past in the late night. The sheet for the blanket didn't appear to be changed by the housekeeping. Otherwise the hotel is quite ok.

Show more
Linda , Singapore
Hatten Hotel Melaka
8.4 Excellent
Based on 17817 reviews

Booked through Agoda and had to postpone the trip due to unforeseen circumstances - my toddler fell sick.

Hotel policy was free cancellation within 3 days and I was a day late hence was asked to bear the full cost. Ultimately allowed to change date but the process was really painful as responses were slow. Upon arrival, we were given a room that was not cleaned after the previous guest left. Given another room eventually but the safe did not work. Wasted time waiting for staff to resolve things. Asked for mineral water at 10pm which was delivered to the room. Staff called at 11pm to confirm the delivery of the water, and that late night call almost woke my sleeping toddler and gave us adults a shock as we were not expecting a call at that hour. Extremely lousy service from the hotel although the room was ok and location was good.

Show more
Lynette , Singapore
KSL Hotel & Resort
7.6 Very good
Based on 23036 reviews

the moment we open the door, the strong smell of cigarettes immediately hit us. didn't want to go through the trouble of changing room, we got the cleaner to spray some air freshener.

what shocked us was when we open one of the bedside drawers, there were cigarette ashes in it.. hey, this is a non-smoking room. anyway this was our 2nd time staying in this hotel. the first experience was definitely better having stayed in tower 2. this time we stayed at the older building, tower 1. another painful thing about this hotel has to be the lift. really gotta check-out at least 30min earlier in order to get into a lift. otherwise you could well spend at least 10min waiting for a lift that you can squeeze into.

Show more
Tay , Singapore
Lexis Hibiscus Port Dickson
8 Very good
Based on 4606 reviews

Only stayed for one night to have a feel of the place. Place is clean but full of mosquito and fly especially at night.

We took the Premium sea facing chalet. Dunnoe how is that possible. Paid a total of 1328 rm for the room. Paid direct to hotel. 300 rm deposit + GST + tourism tax. The buggy ride to the room is fun, but it could take sometime for it to arrive if demand is high or they forgot. we waited ours for 30mins and 4 calls to service line for checkout. Other times, it took about 5-10 mins max. On arrival, we receive about 4 cans of soft drinks , 1 box of muruku cracker and a box of cookie complimentary in the room. Didnt get to see the sunset but our room faces the sunrise which was really Beautiful. Expected sea breeze but there wasnt much at all from the room. our Rm no. is 247. Hibiscus Walk is a gem. They are not halal certified due to a mini bar. But the food is from halal source and affordable. 10rm for fried kwayteow. Offered some activities in the chalet.

Show more
Radin , Singapore
Cititel Mid Valley Hotel
7.5 Very good
Based on 14617 reviews

The hotel is ok. Having stayed at Cititel Mid Valley for more than ten times over the course of the last two years or so, I am slightly surprised that the hotel isn't able to tell nor recognise that I am a repeat customer.

When I took it upon myself to check out if the hotel has any loyalty programme whatsoever in store, I was slightly upset to find that the hotel's 'loyalty programme' (http://www.cititelmidvalley.com/loyalty-en.html) page on its website is hardly useful at all. I would love to sign up for the programme if there's any.

Show more
Muhammad , Singapore
The Gardens - A St Giles Signature Hotel & Residences Kuala Lumpur
8.3 Excellent
Based on 7266 reviews

This hotel offers a competitive rate and is highly recommended by me. Stayed here for about 10 times.

What i like is their service. It was my birthday and they welcomed me with a birthday greeting. To top it all, my room was nicely decorated with ballons and also a birthday chocolate and cookies. In the evening, they send me a birthday sliced cake which was wonderful. An unforgettable experience. Will definitely recommend to others and will stay here again soon. Many thanks to everyone at the hotel.

Show more
Emilza , Singapore
Resorts World Genting - First World Hotel
7.3 Very good
Based on 26433 reviews

Honestly this time I'm happy bcos I been serve by a very good staff , hopefully always can meet this type of good staff .

Also very very disappointed with one of the matter issues, is about the self service check in machine. Bcos this is the first time I check in mid night period OMG i just know that how wasted of the machines good life sleeping at the night time wrking hour is 7am-12mid then offline sleeping . Hope to understand mid night season every one is tiring of course hope to get the room faster but I need to join the long queue for an hour ......... hope can be improved with the above matters

Show more
Wong , Malaysia
One World Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 5268 reviews

Pros: -Spacious room at 40sqm - Real big king bed (can fit 2 adults and 1 kid comfortably) - Wide, vast choice and tastefully buffet breakfast.

The croissant is superb and baked from time to time. - Very well maintained room even not a new hotel. - Big bathroom with separate shower and bath up. Perfectly clean. - 50' LCD tv with menu selection - Connecting hallway to one of the biggest Malaysian mall. - Free and easy parking. - Staffs at the cafe are warm and helpfuk Cons: -Carpet in the room is getting physically fatigue. Feel itchy if not wearing slippers or shoes. - Staff at the reception is a bit plain. Not that arrogant but not that warm. Yet still helpful.

Show more
wardati , Malaysia
Traders Hotel by Shangri-La
8.9 Excellent
Based on 9322 reviews

While the location and rooms were satisfactory , there were far too many negatives for such a prestigious brand !! Poor casual check IN area, desk light in room not repaired despite asking twice, many staff could not answer simple questions on facilities or locations nearby (replied they were new to the hotel !! ) Poor bar facilities , either external hot bar at SKY BAR or a poor coffee shop bar on level 6, draft beer not working , poor staff attitude in many areas , in particular lobby with no knowledge of the area !! Best service was Buggy to Petronas Towers with very friendly knowledgeable driver , Club floor facilities resembled an average coffee shop in many 3* hotels , overall disappointed

PHILIP , United Kingdom
Furama Hotel Bukit Bintang
7.8 Very good
Based on 17051 reviews

This is the second visit that I had choose Funama Hotel as for my business travel. I had make a complain for my first visited last month ago and the issue still remain the same and never improve.

1. Cleanliness still poor and no improvement at all. 2. Sound insulation for the hotel room's door was poor and why the 4 Star hotel rate allowed to use poor plywood door for the hotel room's door? It suppose to use at least 1 hour Fire resistance door for the hotel room's door to ensure hotel guess have enough time to escape if fire happen. 3. It drag a lot of time for check in and check out at the front desk counter. 4. The hotel was encourage for the membership application but it seem that I had submitted my application 1 month ago still no membership notification send to my email for the latest status. 5. Sound proof really a big problem for this hotel because really cannot sleep well especially during the mid night session. Many hotel guess check in late mid night and they create a lot of loud noise during their late mid night check in. You will awake by this loud and annoyed sound and you can hear very clearly what they are talking outside the corridor during they are check in at late mid night. Really a night mad if you cannot sleep well for next day events. I had my dark eyes circle during my 4 days stayed in this hotel.

Show more
Leslie , Malaysia
Concorde Hotel Kuala Lumpur
8.2 Excellent
Based on 7794 reviews

Setup is very very old school. U step in U feels like clock has turn back. Lighting is dim, cause of the yellow lighting they use.

Way to dark. Bad for eyes if wants to read. Hotels looks very great and nice. Check in checkout also quite fast. Breakfast is decent, spread a lot but tastes alright. Nothing to shout about. Quite like the surrounding when dining. Only short coming is due to the size of restaurant, it can't handle so many guests having bf. So u may have to queue for a while if hotel is pack with guest. I waited 30 mins before I get my seats.

Show more
Hian , Singapore
Copthorne Cameron Highlands
7.3 Very good
Based on 11677 reviews

I only choose to stay in this hotel since my stay 8 years ago when it still name with Continental. I have lost count how many times i have stayed in this hotel for the past 18 years but the last visit was a big disappointment.

I have make a remark during reservation for a queen bed but end up with two single bed combine. Then, i requested a hair dryer the moment i checked in but unfortunate it only send to me after 3 reminders to the housekeeping department. What make the worse was the hair dryer was not able to function properly with power supply interruption due to the faulty switch. Lastly but not the least, the sink was faulty with water unable to flow down the drain and clogged up the sink. This hotel will not be in my list again in my next rip to Cameron Highland and is time to try out places.

Show more
danny , Malaysia
Shangri-La Hotel Kuala Lumpur
8.9 Excellent
Based on 3799 reviews

Their friendly staff, from the reception (Club Lounge), F&B (Lemon Garden) to their porters and their doormen.

Their personalised and sincere service showed through their smiles and conversations. At the Lemon Garden, manager Ms Rini and Ms Safijah stood out. The latter's Teh Tarik is to die for! One of the best we've had thus far. We will be back!

Show more
suraya , Singapore
The Shore Hotel & Residences
7.3 Very good
Based on 1867 reviews

Pros: 1) it's big and spacious. 2) swimming facilities 3) not expensive 4) boat station in front of hotel Cons: 1) the apartment is infested with ants.

Super big and black ones. Another group is red ones. Luckily I brought ant bait just in case but still the ants colony is too huge. Seeing the ants swarm to the bait was a very disgusting sight2) toilet bathroom infested with cockroach eggs and small cockroaches. 3) sink in both toilet not working. Here u open tap, there the water leak from bottom to the floor. 4) There's kitchen. But no kitchen soap . No rags. Lucky I brought mine. Literally I went there and housekeep for them. 5) Bring your own towels to swimming pool. 6) tv sound was spoil Conclusion is: be equipped when u go there. Bring your ant bait, rags, kitchen soap, trash bags, hangers if you want to have a comfy stay with your small kids. Dont expect any housekeeping service for your stay.

Show more
Cecelia , Singapore
The Majestic Hotel Kuala Lumpur, Autograph Collection
8.9 Excellent
Based on 2636 reviews

Stayed at The Majestic for one full week accompanied by my wife and daughter. This is a truly remarkable hotel, completely in a class of its own.

The best staff are the concierge and his team, ushers (dressed in colonial attire!) and reception. While some of the dining/restaurant staff were quite pleasant, those serving in the buffet section need some training. They looked very unhappy with their work and made no effort at being friendly to guests. The room cleaner was okay but sometimes did not wash the cups properly, perhaps overworked. All in all, my stay was excellent with the exception of the few areas I have pointed out. I rank this hotel 9 out of 10 and would love to come back again. Thanks to the great team at the Majestic!

Show more
Alex , Rwanda
Hard Rock Hotel Penang
8.3 Excellent
Based on 4903 reviews

We felt truly welcome from the moment we stepped into hotel entrance. We were on spontaneous trip to Penang and we didn't book any hotel in advance.

There was no room available on agoda on our arrival date 20th May, hotel is running on full capacity due to Rock Charity Run , luckily we manage to get one room by walk in. The front desk staff, Apple is very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our first night stay with the awesome pool fun and great sunset scenery. Therefore, we extended our stay and manage to get a room through Agoda. We enjoyed the in room entertainment very much especially in the hot afternoon. We enjoyed the music and free movie! That's awesome! We will definitely come back again.

Show more
WAN , Malaysia
Dorsett Kuala Lumpur
7.9 Very good
Based on 4837 reviews

The location is great because it is near to Bukit Bintang area. However, the Hotel doesn't deserve to be 5-star hotel.

The cleanliness is not great, and it is noticeable that they are inconsiderate about it. Another issue I faced is that when I checked out, I was surprised with additional tax that should be paid even though my reservation was inclusive of all taxes and fees. I tried to explain to the manager, but he doesn't care about my satisfaction, and he insisted that I should pay. I was in hurry because of my flight and the other thing is that they hold 300 deposit, so they take the money they want regardless my agreement. Shame on the management and there hotel.

Show more
Abdulaziz , Saudi Arabia
Resorts World Genting - Hotel on the Park
7.9 Very good
Based on 228 reviews

Imagine a pretty heavy sleeper like myself being awaken at 2-3 am every night for the 2 nights stay there - that's how bad the sound proofing is.

Apparently the quad rooms has adjoining doors and walls so thin that you can hear people's conversation next door, the flushing of toilet, turning on and off of tap.. all clearly heard. It doesn't help that you can also hear vehicles passing by at night. Counter service and housekeeping was decent though. But nope, won't go back any time soon.

Show more
Lin , Singapore
Grand Millennium Kuala Lumpur Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 4774 reviews

GMKL is right smack at Bukit Bintang and next to Pavilion, where the action is. Its the convenience of being there at the centre of it all.

Everywhere is within walking distance. The check-in was smooth and fast. The room was nice and clean. The bathroom was a little bit out-dated but it worked. The bed was hard as I've wanted it to be. The staff was caring and friendly. I missed the breakfast but it was not necessary really because Pavilion offers more food to suit your palate. Walk a little bit further to KLCC and more food awaits. The check-out was fast as well. It was a nice experience staying at GMKL, the place that will come back to stay :-)

Show more
ABDUL , Singapore
The Boulevard - A St Giles Hotel Kuala Lumpur
7.9 Very good
Based on 6010 reviews

I booked a room in Cititel but was so disappointed with their room and facilities thus last minute source for alternative and found Boulevard.

I previously stayed in Boulevard when they were newly open and the impression was arty and cosy. But the room that i stay in now looks old though still comfortable. definitely still much better than cititel. But it was not the arty room which i had last time. not sure if there were some renovation and they change the concept. Though the room looks old, the other parts of the hotel looks well maintained even the pool and restaurant. It was well connected to the mid valley shopping centre thus nothing to complain about the location. we had a great stay.

Show more
Mei , Singapore
Hilton Kuala Lumpur Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 2559 reviews

I should have give Hilton 4 star instead of 5. I booked via Agoda with a King Deluxe Lake View. I was arranging to stay in a twin-bed room.

I loved the water pressure in the toilet and its cleanliness of the toilet as well as the towel. Followed in the Ramadan, I could not book dinner with the Restaurant? for no A La Carte was available. I had to eat in the Lounge. Check out fast and convenient to take a cap or walk to the nearby MRT/Komuter/Rapid Lines or KL Ekpress. The Manager also should confirm if Internet is free so the Hotpot log in WILL NOT Show the charge (MRY~29 for a day) or more. It confuses the guests to hesitate to log in and take times for them to check back and forth with the Magic. Simply Free is Free. Just log in with Name and/or Room Number for password. Finally I clicked on one day with charge but HHonour is free.

Show more
Le , Vietnam
Tune Hotel klia2
7.5 Very good
Based on 8427 reviews

Staying here regularly due to nature of work, and recently had utilise the RM90 day-use rate which is really worth it! I arrived 7am in the morning and paying for 8-hours day stay just perfect for my next schedule flight at 4pm! I manage to had warm shower, enough sleep, get my dirty laundry settled so I don't have to worry about it when reach home.

Really glad that coin laundry is provided with detergent and softener!

Show more
Nurul , Malaysia
Imperial Heritage Hotel Melaka
7.7 Very good
Based on 3879 reviews

The hotel is close to places of interest. Very fast wifi. A slightly cozy look. Functional shower. Friendly staff.

Soundproof (or there maybe no one staying next to our room). The hotel's parking area is next to the building, it is extremely agonizing if you park your car on the top floor, no elevator is there. The toilet bowl is too close to the wall. Small bed. Aircond was not well maintained, we were forced to sleep with annoying sounds from the aircond, including a splash of water from the aircond. TV channels are not interesting, no cartoon channels. Some electrical plug is damaged.

Show more
Mohd , Malaysia
PARKROYAL Kuala Lumpur
8.2 Excellent
Based on 6587 reviews

I have been to Kuala Lumpur numerous times before with mum but this is my first time with her in a wheelchair.

I know the city is not a handicapped friendly. One just has to look at the absence of lifts & wheelchair ramps at majority of the train stations within the city. The pedestrian footpaths are poorly maintained with many cracks & crevices which are not comfortable to anyone seated in a wheelchair. Most often than not, toilets for handicapped are non-existent. Thus, with such issues in mind, I had to properly look into which hotel would suit us back in that I do not wish to have to deal with taxi service for travelling within the city as they aren't really a trustworthy nor honest bunch of drivers about. (Side note : Use Uber/Grab should you need a taxi). ParkRoyal KL is situated in the popular Bukit Bintang shopping & entertainment belt, thus it was convenient to get to the malls nearby, particularly The Berjaya Time Square, Lot 10, Pavillion & Sungei Wang Plaza.

Show more
SHAMSURI , Singapore
Berjaya Times Square Hotel, Kuala Lumpur
7.9 Very good
Based on 6158 reviews

The place is situated at a very convenient place. It is just opposite the metro. There is a shopping mall located inside the hotel building.

You do not have to worry about wet weather. However, regretted much for going to KL during the Chinese New Year holiday. Most of the shops were closed. Mainly the Chinese shops were closed. There were a lot of Arabs in Berjaya Times Square mall. The mall is very big and there is a lot of shopping stuffs you can get there at a very affordable price. It's like a shopping heaven! You will never regret. The swimming pool at the hotel was huge and the water was very cold. I was literally freezing. Oh yes, I could see KLCC and the KL towers from my room. It was amazingly breathtaking and beautiful. However, upon check-in, the service was slightly slow as the counter that was open was little. We had to wait quite some time to check in. But the staff there was very friendly and nice. Even though he was a trainee, he gave us on of the best service ever. Berjaya Times Square is one of the best hotel ever in KL!

Show more
Siti , Singapore
Imperial Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 5168 reviews

Not giving any information about WiFi Password, Parking Payment for guest. Not proactive, waiting for customer to ask then only giving explanation.

Could be not well trained on Customer Service Skill. I have to come back to validate my parking card as the counter never asked about if I have any parking card or not. For Facilities, a lots of items had been reduced / not supplied and if required has to ask for it. This not reasonable as the room charged is not that cheap. TQ...

Show more
HENRY , Malaysia
Hotel Jen Penang By Shangri-La
8 Very good
Based on 4052 reviews

My first stay here, will definitely come back again in near future. Conveniently located next to Komtar, it is very short walking distance to free hop on hop off bus, and 5-10 minutes walk to famous eatery places at Kimberly & Penang Road.

Staffs are friendly. The gym facility is great with nice bog pool to relax in the afternoon after all morning walking. Nice clean spacious room & bathroom. Most delightful that is all my preferences & requests was fulfilled. As a hotelier myself, I will highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here in future instead of Cititel Penang where I used to stay during all my previous trip.

Show more
Royston , Malaysia
Sunway Putra Hotel Kuala Lumpur
8.2 Excellent
Based on 7933 reviews

Initial encounter was bad because the hotel did not tell us earlier that we could not check in early.

We were tired and were told only when we wanted to check in that we could not check in early. In the event the hotel had no room for us to check in early they should have told us earlier so I could change my booking to another hotel. So far this is the only hotel that I encountered that did not let me check in early. I was asked to pay to upgrade my room to be able to check in early. Cenang beach is quite a distance away, Langkawi parade mall behind the hotel is a plus, convenient to buy food, drinks etc. There were also shop lots opposite the hotel. The views for a superior room from the balcony (eagles square, mountain, lake and sea views) were good. The buffet breakfast had a variety although the variety was about the same every day. Can skip the porridge as it is usually not very warm. The shower was easy to use. Room came with disposable slippers so do not need to bring own to hotel. Hotel staff were helpful with directions / recommendations. Travel counter staff were helpful with tour queries however their pricing for tour packages was much higher.
